nodes.bodyText: Refactored findOne to take conceptSetId and workspaceId to satisfy both calls and exceptions

Cool. FWIW,  you could push this down. into the servcie as well, and have one method that returns an Optional<ConceptSet> and another that throws your exception. Since you're doing this twice, that might clean. up. your controller code.
Reverted this and made 2 different methods on service.
Removed the conditional because findAll return an empty collection of no concept Ids match.
Yes, and you drop a ! for the win.
@jaycarlton added your recommended builder pattern to help construction.

Awesome!  You can.  also make. a. vaildation function check required args are present or throw.
nit: I'm used to see the work happen in build(), there's. no reason it can't work this way.
Moved this into CommonMappers
Test to assert that findAll return empty collection when nothing is found.
maybe name this one. existingConceptSet. It can be final (nit)
Done.
Why not include this function in. your ConceptSEtMapper?

^
I think it should be possible but I'd be OK with waiting until there is a mapper for Concept as well.
I think with that addition, it would be a lot easier for MapStruct to infer the Long -> Concept mapping pattern.
I'm just not sure if it will automatically pick figure out the transitive relationship of Long -> DbConcept -> Concept if it knows how to do Long -> DbConcept and DbConcept -> Concept.
As is, I believe you'd have to use an AfterMapping annotation since the static method of ConceptsController.toClientConcept can't be provided through DI.
Transitive, invisible conversion chains scare me a bit. This is why C++ has explicit constructors. The rare cases where it runs away from you are scary. Much less scary with less common types.
I agree with Eric. I will file a ticket for this work: https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-4451
This looks very similar to toClientConceptSetWithConcepts. Could you make a service method that takes in a sort order and unify some of this?
Done.
Since you're. ignoring the concepts field, you can make a helper method that knows how to do what  you need. See e.g. org.pmiops.workbench.utils.WorkspaceMapper#afterWorkspaceIntoResearchPurpose()
this can be done with this ticket: https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-4451
nit: maybe. just findByConcept..., to match. the others. teh return type indicates. you're only getting one.
Done, also added Test class for ConceptSetDaoTest since it didn't exist.
[please change] I wouldn't put int-to-string mappings in CommonMappers, because you might get false positives with other types. I.e.  MapStruct doesn't know that these are etag-specific.
That looks like a great solution to me.
how about toHydratedConceptSet()? or toPopulatedConceptSet()?
Renamed toHydratedConceptSet()
💯 for pulling daos out of the controller.

It's confusing to see a method name. with no verb unless it's on a builder. I was thinking this was a getConcepts() method at first.
aside: I'm starting to wonder if this controller needs a broader name: some of. these methods don't talk about datasets at all.
Yes, Data Sets, Concept Sets and Cohort Builder will be more interchangeable in the future and the lines will start to blur a bit.
I think you can return an iterable from. here if that's helpful, for example if the result set is very long.

Seems that we have a cap on how many a user can select: https://github.com/all-of-us/workbench/blob/freemabd/address-comments/api/src/main/java/org/pmiops/workbench/api/ConceptSetsController.java#L51-L51
aside: I could've sworn another mapper already had one of these...
I moved them from WorkspaceMapper into CommonMappers
Can you test the other direction? Or is that not implemented yet?

It's not implemented yet. I created a ticket for it: https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-4455
It's a little more involved than just copy over ConceptSet to DbConceptSet. So I want to think about it a bit... needs to hit BQ with proper OMOP table to get counts.
is this an automatic ID? If so, then why specify it?
Nice catch... must have been on autopilot.
